Crimes.Crime_Name: Failure to comply with document submission requirements under Citizenship Act
Crimes.Legal_Issue: Reasonableness of citizenship judge's decision despite missing key evidence
Crimes.Evidence_Type: Residency documentation, diplomatic passport, supporting records
Crimes.Basis_of_Claim: Proof of physical presence in Canada for at least 1,095 days
Crimes.Key_Factor_in_Determination: Omission of diplomatic passport covering a 9-month period
Crimes.Proceeding_Type: Administrative hearing followed by judicial review
Crimes.Application_Error: Failure to submit critical document (diplomatic passport)
Crimes.Legal_Standard: Applicant must prove eligibility on balance of probabilities
Crimes.Application_Factor: Marginal sufficiency of claimed residency days (1,101 out of 1,095 required)
Crimes.Decision_Outcome: Citizenship granted initially, later set aside
Crimes.Authority: Minister of Immigration, Refugees and Citizenship
Crimes.Decision_Review_Issue: Whether the citizenship judge adequately addressed evidentiary gaps
Crimes.Outcome_of_Review: Remitted for reconsideration by a different citizenship judge
Crimes.Cause_of_Refusal: Failure to provide diplomatic passport covering a critical period
Crimes.Evidentiary_Issues: Missing documentation for a 9-month period; incomplete supporting evidence
Crimes.Procedural_Fairness: Concerns about adequacy of reasoning due to unaddressed omission
Crimes.Credibility_Issues: Potential credibility concerns due to unexplained gap in documentation
Crimes.Legal_Defense_or_Challenge: N/A (applicant did not challenge burden of proof)
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Failure to address material omission in evidence
Crimes.Omission_Type: Failure to submit required travel/residency document

Crimes.Crime_Name: False or misleading information in citizenship application
Crimes.Legal_Issue: Reasonableness of citizenship judge's approval despite incomplete evidence
Crimes.Credibility_Assessment: Questionable due to unexplained absence of key document
Crimes.Evidence_Type: Residency documentation, diplomatic passport, application forms
Crimes.Basis_of_Claim: Proof of physical presence in Canada for at least 1,095 days
Crimes.Key_Factor_in_Determination: Omission of diplomatic passport covering a 9-month period
Crimes.Proceeding_Type: Administrative hearing followed by judicial review
Crimes.Application_Error: Incomplete application due to missing critical document
Crimes.Legal_Standard: Applicant must prove eligibility on balance of probabilities
Crimes.Application_Factor: Claimed 1,101 days of presence with gaps in evidence
Crimes.Decision_Outcome: Citizenship granted initially, later set aside
Crimes.Authority: Minister of Immigration, Refugees and Citizenship
Crimes.Decision_Review_Issue: Whether the citizenship judge properly assessed completeness of evidence
Crimes.Outcome_of_Review: Remitted for reconsideration by a different citizenship judge
Crimes.Cause_of_Refusal: Failure to provide diplomatic passport and incomplete supporting evidence
Crimes.Evidentiary_Issues: Missing documentation for a 9-month period; lack of corroboration
Crimes.Procedural_Fairness: Deficient reasoning due to failure to address material omission
Crimes.Credibility_Issues: Raised due to unexplained gap and failure to produce official travel record
Crimes.Legal_Defense_or_Challenge: N/A (no defense raised regarding burden of proof)
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Failure to justify reliance on incomplete evidence
Crimes.Omission_Type: Failure to disclose relevant travel/residency document
